title: Planned Karthus nerfs
body:
Lay Waste (Q)

•Base Damage: 50/70/90/110/130 >>> 45/65/85/105/125


•Isolated Base Damage: 100/140/180/220/260 >>> 90/130/170/210/250


Requiem (R)
•Base Damage: 250/400/550 >>> 200/350/500

Karthus Jungle is the clear offender and the reason for nerfs. So could we pls not target Karthus Mid and instead his jungling? Maybe get him out of the jungle completly. Riot loves to nerf a champ on all roles even though only 1 role really is a major pain in the ass.

Karthus was in the state he is for how long now? Only because  people are like: Hey, Karthus jungle, yay, fuck the enemy team. 
Riot: Lets nerf Karthus on every role.

Look yall, it's not even really a nerf. It's a HALF-REVERT to the buffs given to him last year. Originally, they gave him an extra 15% AP ratio to his ult (was 60%, now it's 75%), and +10 Damage to his Q. This isn't really anything to be honest. 

I also don't understand the nerfs because tbh, it's probably not going to do what Riot wants them to do. Karthus is still going to scale, and do it rather well at that, but that's what he was designed to do. The other problem, is that Powerfarming is Karthus's main Shtick outside of his ult. If JG Karthus is the problem in particular, then they need to make it so that Karthus actually has to interact with opponents to be able to succeed in the game. Maybe if you made it so that Karthus only gets mana back off *minions* (from the E Passive), but get increased mana back from *non-ultimate* champion kills so that he's rewarded for more than Farming, he'd probably be better balanced that way. 

This is from someone who plays pretty much absolutely *nothing but Karthus*. I'm not plat or diamond or anything, but it's something to consider.
Guess what it's called when they "revert buffs"......... a nerf.

And why not? That kind of champion shouldn't be ever viable. He pushs the wave waits for lv6 and picks some free kills and in the late game he takes half ur HP bar or even more with his R. How is that crap even balanced ?

It's true. A very large amount of champions have shields, heals, untargetabilities, or something at the very least to negate Karthus ult.

A majority of the ones who don't are going to be building hourglass/hex/lifesteal rather early on, and most of the remainder are bruisers/tanks who don't care if it hits them anyway.

It falls off hard if the enemy is smart, despite the damage scaling very well. It can't hurt you if it never hits you.

Except early game, Karthus is only going to be using his ult to apply pressure to fights, or to quickscope a retreating low health target, whose likely exited the fight. Not a lot of folk are going to have those options early on, especially Lifesteal, Hex, or Hourglass, and their resources are bound to be blown from said fight.
This is true, however, in the early game Karthus can only ult like twice. Even if he uses it on CD I'm pretty sure he'll be hitting level 11 before he can use it a third time.
